On 7/30/07, Paul King <paulk@...> wrote:
> I can do some classification with naming conventions but having arbitrary
> groups provides more flexibility. I don't think you need to go over
> board here though, I don't need really fined grained flexibility here.
> If you want that you are better off looking at what Clover 2 or Agitar
> dashboard do by bringing other measures of risk into the picture.

Paul, all,

I've been mulling over the right interface for this kind of
functionality.  One thing that would really help is if people who
would really like to see categories in JUnit could chime in with their
80/20 point.  I have a feeling that there's probably a really simple
interface that would do 80% of what people want, and a really
complicated one that would do the other 20%.

For example, Paul, what's the difference between "arbitrary groups"
and "really fine-grained flexibility" in your post above?  Thanks,

   David Saff
